intro: Turnera sidoides var. herteriana, commonly known as the Herter's turnera, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
